quote: ''Senate Bill No. 1733 or the People's Freedom of Information Act is the embodiment of the government's obligation and commitment to be transparent and accountable to its citizens. Through this measure, we hope to afford our people improved and speedy access to public records relating to matters of public concerns without cost. This proposed piece of legislation hopes to promote a culture of openness and transparency among our public servants and our public institutions.  This is essential and indispensable in curbing the systemic corruption that has been plaguing our government.''
''I am interested in looking at how they would implement this because I maintain that the issue is not blood relations or family names but... corruption.'' -Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''Yes, I am in favor of that because the spirit of the law that was passed during the mid-90s was to make the rates equitable. However, (these were) not indexed (to adjust to) inflation or the consumer price index. It didn't move. The rates then that were supposed to be for high-income earners are now actually the income being earned by junior level (employees). So we need to correct that.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''This is our job. We cannot be just rubber stamps here... Lasting peace (in Mindanao) should have no deadline. It should be approached cautiously, carefully.''

''I'm fully supportive of the arbitration case as well as our claims to those islands. In fact I am the author of the Archipelagic Baselines Law that formally legitimized our claim to these islands.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''Revising the economic provisions in the Constitution should open domestic shipping and open the Philippine sealanes for trade and investments.''
''I'm all for the promotion and the protection of LGBT rights.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''Yes, and expand it further to include the farmers and fishermen, and streamline or purge the list to make sure that there are no leakages.'' Interview with InterAksyon in Mandaluyong City, Dec. 18, 2015
''Job contractualization is illegal under labor laws therefore I'm against it.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''I would have to say that the Filipino family may not be able to withstand a Western style divorce. So for now, we will just have to encourage the accessibility to the legal separation options, which are already in the Family Code.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

QUALIFIED NO
''I believe that if it's going to be done contentiously, there should be other options... I believe there are so many (other) options that are less contentious. - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

I'm very open to that. However, the devil is in the details. So you cannot just say in general terms that Il'l go for it. Because if the details there or the provisions stated in that law will be detrimental to the interest of specific sectors, then we need to take a second look.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''I think we didn't stop. So why should we?'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''I am against it as a national policy or a conscious effort for us to export our skilled labor. So the solution to that is to generate employment in the country.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''Yes. It is already in the judiciary, in the justice system. So let wheels turn.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''I believe that we may not be ready for that but I'm ready to listen.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''I'm against it. It has no benefit whatsoever. Nobody's asking for it whether domestically or abroad. It's an additional burden to the parents, to the students, and the teachers. And the public education system is not ready for it (in terms of) infrastructure, curriculum, or the training of instructors.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

QUALIFIED YES
''Agrarian reform, if it would be continued at all, should be given to beneficiaries through cooperatives as opposed to what's happening right now wherein they give (the land) to the awardees individually. Do it through cooperatives to empower the farmers. You give them facility even for agribusiness. The government can use the cooperatives as a medium to extend subsidies and support.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

QUALIFIED YES
''Yes, but it should be time-bound. It should not be a perpetual peace talks arrangement. There should be... utmost, a six-month window to finalize any agreement. After that, it will just show that this is but another ploy for them to recoup and lick wounds.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015
''I will let the judiciary decide on that matter.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Dec. 18, 2015

''You impeach one if he committed a big crime against the Filipino people. But this DAP, the President did not commit any crime. In fact, he used public funds for other projects that were beneficial.''
